title: Should I start ranked yet?
body:
I got to level 30 recently and I haven't started ranked yet but I've just gone a losing spree in normals right now, does that mean that:

A. Match making will think I due for a win and give me good games for the placements
or
B. Match making will think I a scrub and put me a team of scrubs for my placements.

Edit: I've also been noticing a lot of ranked people in my games lately.
http://i.imgur.com/3dKADzT.png
Also note that most of those games are nemesis

replies.body:
TL;DR: Only play solo queue if you want to improve your **own** gameplay, do not spend your time criticizing other players mistakes because that doesn't help you improve.

*I have used rank and rating interchangeably below*

Playing solo queue ranked is one of the best ways to determine your **current skill** over all as a player. You should only play ranked if you want to see your rating AND learn and improve from each game. This means not looking at external reasons for losses but looking at your own mistakes in game and how you can get better. Obviously there are some games that are frustrating losses, a dc, an afk , an extremely negative player. But those games are far and few between (in my experience) and you shouldn't let those instances take up too much of your time (don't dwell on the un-winnable games and tilt, focus on the winnable games and what you can do to impact the game more). Don't worry about others just focus on your own gameplay.

Personally for me ranked has been a great learning experienced and really helped me improve as a player (some of the learning was even applicable in the real world =O ). But it is what **you** make of it, as long as you focus on **your own** game and look to improve on your mistakes you will find it a rewarding experience.

Maraudaur I humbly disagree... in fact I'm actually concerned about encouraging people to focus only on their **own ** gameplay...

End of the day its a team game, period. 

If you want to practice basic mechanics - then thats what modes such as Normal and Co-op vs AI are for.

Ranked is for people who want to work together to achieve a result - that result is victory and finding ways of achieving better paths to victory. 

An essential part of working together is providing constructive criticism.  Unfortunately for every receptive player that takes pointers well - there is another player who will reply with 'dnt f---- tell me what to do' or 'AFK' 

My most memorable solo Q games were instances when other players were keen to win and open minded to try new strategies such as lane swaps, rotations, etc. on the fly.  Repeatedly telling people to ** focus on their own game only** won't help to encourage this creative behavior...

My biggest regret is playing ranked back in season 2 when I was literally terrible at this game, I now know I have so much to work on because I didnt actually bother getting better at the game. My low elo shows how much of a struggle it is.
